meanings.definition: A loud, harsh, piercing cry or sound.
meanings.sent1: The screeches of the owl echoed through the night.
meanings.sent2: I heard the screeches of tires as the car came to a sudden stop.
meanings.sent3: The screeches of the monkey made everyone laugh at the zoo.
meanings.sent4: The screeches of the tea kettle signaled that it was ready.
meanings.sent5: The screeches of the seagulls filled the air at the beach.

meanings.definition: To make a loud, harsh, piercing cry or sound.
meanings.sent1: The cat screeches when it wants to be let outside.
meanings.sent2: The brakes screeches as the car skidded on the wet road.
meanings.sent3: The toddler screeches with delight when playing with bubbles.
meanings.sent4: The violin screeches in protest as the musician played too loudly.
meanings.sent5: The wind screeches through the trees on stormy nights.
